metadata.title: USN-5272-1 -- HDF5 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5272-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libhdf5-doc - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-mpich2-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-dev - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 hdf5-helpers - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-mpi-dev - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-mpich2-dev - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-openmpi-dev - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 hdf5-tools - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-openmpi-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 libhdf5-serial-dev - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
